categories.title: Developments in AI Agents and Confidential AI

content.text: Welcome to the team @Esk3nder – let's build the future of AI agents!

Discussions are emerging around the creation of a standardized framework for AI agents, similar to how ERC-20 shaped NFTs. Multi-use TEE agents with no risk of losing funds are being explored, and the agent creation and launch process is expected to become more streamlined soon.
@VegaGenesisTM @breakingbarbie let’s see what AI judges think of your pitch compared to human ones.

A new feature has been added to support Secret AI LLM, allowing Eliza-based agents to protect their data using Secret’s Confidential AI. The update does not impact existing code and includes integration with generateText and generateObject functions.
A bug fix was implemented to allow re-initialization of an agent through the client direct API on the `/agents/:agentId/set` route. This rollback ensures that agents can be restarted as expected.
A fix was applied to catch a typing error in the codebase.
Discord actions were fixed, making all of them work except for the download media plugin. The `ytdl` issue will be addressed in a future PR.
A fix was introduced to properly import plugins from the plugin registry, resolving an issue related to plugin loading.
The `devcontainer.json` file was updated to correct the port mapping syntax, replacing `-p=<host_port>:<container_port>` with `-p <host_port>:<container_port>` to prevent syntax errors.

Looking for support or feedback while you build with ElizaOS? Join the ElizaOS Builder’s Chat, our global community of devs, founders, and AI enthusiasts. In this invite-only Telegram group, you can collaborate live with the ElizaOS community.

categories.title: Recent Updates and Fixes in ElizaOS

content.text: The documentation has been updated to consolidate redundant pages, improve readability, and emphasize conceptual explanations over code snippets. API pages have also been revised for better accuracy, with links to sources added where possible.
A bug was reported regarding the README file in the 'client-direct' package, which appears to be more related to a fine-tuning plugin rather than the direct client.
An update was made to 'image.yaml'. The pull request includes a structured template for documenting risks, background information, testing steps, and potential documentation changes.
@PatrickAlphaC suggests that wallet DevOps certifications would be a great idea.
Rabby Wallet allows users to send on-chain memos, a feature not available in MetaMask, making it a preferred choice for some users.

categories.title: Being a DAO Contributor and Future DAO Partnerships

content.text: Being a DAO contributor can sometimes feel overwhelming.
In the future, DAO partners will play a role in curating content.

The Kaito airdrop is part of an emerging trend where most airdrops rely on on-chain transactions for structured data. However, large language models (LLMs) can analyze and structure any kind of data. There have been experiments with chat analysis to identify and reward contributors.

Development efforts have focused on package improvements, including enhancements to the test plugin, new features, and six bug fixes. A total of 10 contributors merged eight pull requests, with major work involving various improvements.

categories.title: Discussion on Web3 and Recent Events

content.text: @blendino_, @malik672_, and @elizaOS were involved in a discussion where a lot happened.
@malik672_, @blendino_, and @elizaOS also discussed how one of them was not originally into Web3.

The agent system has been refactored to improve character management, error handling, and runtime logging. A new endpoint allows agents to be started by character name, and CLI commands have been enhanced for better flexibility and usability. Additionally, redundant character loading functions have been removed, and file upload processing for audio, messaging, and images has been reorganized for improved reliability.

The memory system has been improved with optional agent IDs, global memory queries, and enhanced retrieval flexibility. A new KnowledgeMetadata framework has been introduced to support source tracking, scoping, and metadata validation. Additionally, browser compatibility has been enhanced by decoupling the runtime from Node.js, introducing a FileLoader abstraction, and making the system environment-agnostic.

categories.title: ElizaOS Development Updates and Community Initiatives

content.text: ElizaOS has introduced the Builder’s Chat, an invite-only Telegram group for developers, founders, and AI enthusiasts to collaborate and seek support while building with ElizaOS.
Esk3nder has joined the ElizaOS team, contributing to the future of AI agents.

Several bug fixes and improvements were made to ElizaOS, including fixes for agent re-initialization, plugin imports, Discord actions, and package installations. Additionally, new features such as support for Secret AI LLM and improved test plugins were introduced.
A major refactor was implemented to improve memory queries, knowledge metadata, and browser support, making the system more flexible and cross-platform compatible.

A bug was reported where an AI agent incorrectly responded to both image and text-based tweets with a generic visual description. The issue was observed across multiple tweets and is under investigation.
Development efforts included package improvements, new features, and six bug fixes, with contributions from ten developers merging eight pull requests.
